data.body: Closes #5984.

data.title: More Lobby Options
data.body:
+Concretes for D2K (Open/Close no concrete causes damage.)
+Engineer settings (1 Engineer, Multi Engineer, From Out.) #6049
+Enemy Low Power (Visable/Invisable)
+MCV Repacks (Can CY turn back into MCV)
+Short Game (End/continue the game when all buildings are destroyed)

data.body: Small tweak to avoid copying the input sequence in Exts.Random when possible.

data.title: Cloaked enemy units should be visible if they're within one cell range
data.body: It is weird that enemy tanks will move around a phase transport to avoid collision but won't see it. Cloaked unit should be visible if it's in a neighboring cell.

data.title: Attack cursor is shown while hovering over an invisible camo pillbox
data.body: This reveals the location of the invisible pillbox.

data.title: Gap generator and oil derrick can be targeted from above the shroud
data.body: Gap generator can be targeted by moving the cursor in the middle of the shrouded circle. And engineers can be ordered to capture an oil derrick even if it's under shroud.

data.title: Don’t cancel MoveAdjacentTo / MoveWithinRange when target becomes invalid
data.body:
The old "move within range" logic used by the attack code cached the target position at the time the order was issued, which caused units to move to the wrong cell if the target moves, but also meant that the units would continue moving to the target's position if the target is killed.

The rewrite in #5617 fixed units pathing to the wrong cell, but introduced a regression (#5968) where units would stop moving if the target is destroyed.

This fixes that regression by switching the target to a static cell if the original target becomes invalid.

data.title: Actor retains control group when captured or hijacked
TS - Units move more quickly horizontally than vertically
data.body:
It appears that units move more quickly when traveling East-West than North-South. I moved infantry/vehicles equal screen distances vertically and horizontally and noticed a discrepancy in arrival times.

I figure this is due to cells having different aspect ratios than RA and unit velocities are not being scaled accordingly.

data.title: Fix unit collection crates and drop-zone maps.
data.body: Cleaned up version of #5952.

data.title: Unhardcoded RenderInfantry sequence names
data.body:
This removes the remaining hardcoded sequence names in RenderInfantry and exposes them to yaml.

Shouldn't cause any regressions, but it's probably safer to wait until after the July release before merging this.

data.title: Overhaul the RA sidebar.
data.body:
![sidebar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/3610300/6a739d6c-0d89-11e4-9dfc-b580d795f9c3.png)

This generalizes the TD ingame UI code, and uses it to implement a new command-panel design for RA.
This cuts down on the code duplication, and gives RA a much-needed facelift.

Closes #2394, #2385, #4980, #5108, #5543, and probably others.

data.title: Faster replay browser loading
data.body:
Partial fix to address the core issue (slow replay browser loading) behind the suggestion given in #5942.

This parallelizes the loading process and removes a few bottlenecks. An informal test with 1200 replays sees the "Load Replays" time reduced from 3527 ms to 1210 ms on my dual core machine. Machines with more cores might see even bigger improvements but eventually IO will take over as the bottleneck so things will plateau somewhere.

This doesn't actually implement any lazy or background loading as suggested in #5942. That would probably be worthwhile, particularly for when the replay files are not in the file cache and waiting on IO becomes the main issue.

data.title: There's no way to select the CD location
data.body:
The UI has an option to install music from the CD, however there's no way to select the location of an ISO file, or where the CD is mounted, making it impossible to select the source for the data.
I also haven't had access to any devices with optical (cd) readers for years, and expecting users to have one is a bit unrealistic nowadays.

data.title: Mod download data fails if there's not native IPv4
data.body:
Downloading mod data fails if there's no IPv4. "Host Unreachable".
The game should not explicitly try IPv4 and use IPv6 if available (especially since many networks use NAT64 as a transition mechanism, which leaves remote IPv4 hosts reachable).

data.title: Units somtimes stop moving before reaching their destination

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
A regression from #5617 according to pchote.

```
(13:33:45) antares79: what I have seen a lot lately is units stopping midway to their destination when they are travelling in a group
(13:34:07) pchote: that's a regression of my attack logic changes
(13:34:12) pchote: that was really merged too early :(
(13:34:40) pchote: the fix should be easy enough, but people keep on throwing more interesting problems in front of me
(13:35:13) pchote: the problem is that the new MoveWithinRange implementation returns as soon as the pathing fails
(13:35:18) pchote: while the old implementation would wait and repath
(13:35:39) pchote: the new implementation has a wrapper in the Follow activity that does this, but that really wants to move up a level into the implementation itself
(13:36:04) pchote: or to change the things that use that interface to repath themselves
(13:36:33) pchote: I expect that the worst offender for this bad behaviour will be attackmove
```
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3149958-units-somtimes-stop-moving-before-reaching-their-destination?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Fix aircraft losing selection outside the map borders
data.body: Also makes aircraft selectable again outside the map borders, so they don't get lost anymore.

data.title: Implement queued reloading for aircraft
data.body: Since aircraft need to be reloaded, it is very time consuming and boring to reload 20 helicopters at one helipad for example. But if there was a feature that reloaded each aircraft one after another when a group of them are ordered to reload, it would make this process much easier. The same logic could also be applied to repairs at the service depot.

data.title: Adds the RequiresPrerequisites field into ProvidesCustomPrerequisite
data.body:
and all the logic behind it.

This fixes #5958

data.title: Recursive OnCapture through ChangeOwner.
Added ability to make upgrades
data.body:
This is a continued version of #5375 rebased and ready to go.

If you want a testcase go to this branch https://github.com/WolfGaming/OpenRA/tree/D2KUpgradeTest it adds an upgrade queue and some upgrades to D2K, 4 of them are used to unlock buildings/units and 1 of them is used to give a 10% armor reduction for infantry.

data.title: Insta build removing multiple actors from war factory queue
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3696546/3580321/e8ace138-0bd2-11e4-9736-c720eea15151.png)
When I have instant build speed enabled and build any vehicle by either spamming or shift clicking it, it then proceeds to charge me for all of them but only produces a couple of them. I spent $20,000 on 7 V2s in my first test, that's 15 less then I was supposed to get.

data.title: Merge the RA helicopter and plane queues.
data.body:
The faction-specific aircraft queues in RA are inconsistent with the other queues, and will not be supported by the new command-panel UI (#5108).

A couple of alternatives were discussed in IRC, and we decided that the best solution was to merge the two queues and reintroduce a way to restrict per-actor production factories (like the old `BuildAt` property).

The easiest way to do this will probably be to add `BuildAt` back to `BuildableInfo`, but have it match against `ProductionInfo.Produces` instead of a specific actor name.

data.title: Build all cheat no longer works as intended for TD mod
data.body: Probably related to the recently introduced tech levels. Enabling the cheat does not give access to the other factions' build options anymore.

data.title: Scrolling on replays' filters not working
data.body:
![2014-07-14 23_33_18-openra](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/533177/3577624/b839a286-0b9e-11e4-9530-e042ba7f2475.png)

Scrolling works well on the replays' list, but apparently not on the filters' ones.
